knife.lazy.sliceknife — Lazily evaluated slicing knife¶

class knife.lazy.sliceknife(*things, **kw)[source]¶

Lazily evaluated slicing knife.

append(*things)¶

Insert things after other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things 
>>> __(3, 4, 5).append(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6).peek()
[3, 4, 5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
ascii(errors='strict')¶

byte encode outgoing things with the 'ascii' codec.

Parameters:errors (string) –

error handling for decoding issues

>>> from knife import __
>>> from stuf.six import u, b
>>> test = __([1], True, r't', b('i'), u('g'), None, (1,))
>>> test.ascii().wrap_each().peek()
(b('[1]'), b('True'), b('t'), b('i'), b('g'), b('None'), b('(1,)'))
at(n, default=None)¶

Slice off incoming thing found at index n.

Parameters:
  • n (integer) – index of some incoming thing
  • default –

    default returned if nothing is found at n

    >>> from knife import __
>>> # default behavior
>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).at(2).fetch()
3
>>> # return default value if nothing found at index
>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).at(10, 11).fetch()
11
baseline()¶

Restore incoming things to baseline snapshot().

>>> from knife import __
>>> undone = __(1, 2, 3).prepend(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
>>> undone.peek()
[1, 2, 3, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
>>> undone.snapshot().append(1).append(2).peek()
[1, 2, 3, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2]
>>> undone.baseline().peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3]
bytes(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

byte encode outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) –

    error handling for encoding issues

    >>> test = __([1], True, r't', b('i'), u('g'), None, (1,))
>>> test.bytes().wrap_each().peek()
(b('[1]'), b('True'), b('t'), b('i'), b('g'), b('None'), b('(1,)'))
choice()¶

Randomly slice off one incoming thing.

>>> __(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6).choice().fetch()
3
clear()¶

Clear everything.

dice(n, fill=None)¶

Slice one iterable incoming thing into n iterable incoming things.

Parameters:
  • n (integer) – number of incoming things per slice
  • fill – value to pad out incomplete iterables
 
>>> __('moe', 'larry', 'curly', 30, 40, 50, True).dice(2, 'x').fetch()
[('moe', 'larry'), ('curly', 30), (40, 50), (True, 'x')]
fetch()¶

Return outgoing things wrapped with wrap().

first(n=0)¶

Slice off n things from the starting end of incoming things or just the first incoming thing.

Parameters:n (integer) –

number of incoming things

>>> # default behavior
>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).first().fetch()
5
>>> # first things from index 0 to 2
>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).first(2).fetch()
[5, 4]
initial()¶

Slice off everything except the last incoming thing.

>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).initial().fetch()
[5, 4, 3, 2]
last(n=0)¶

Slice off n things from the tail end of incoming things or just the last incoming thing.

Parameters:n (integer) –

number of incoming things

>>> # default behavior
>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).last().fetch()
1
>>> # fetch last two things
>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).last(2).fetch()
[2, 1]
original()¶

Restore incoming things to original snapshot.

>>> undone = __(1, 2, 3).prepend(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
>>> undone.peek()
[1, 2, 3, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
>>> undone.original().peek()
[1, 2, 3]
params(*args, **kw)¶

Assign positional and keyword arguments used whenever worker() is invoked.

peek()¶

Preview current incoming things wrapped with wrap().

prepend(*things)¶

Insert things before other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things 
>>> from knife import __
>>> __(3, 4, 5).prepend(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6).peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 3, 4, 5]
rest()¶

Slice off everything except the first incoming thing.

>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).rest().fetch()
[4, 3, 2, 1]
sample(n)¶

Randomly slice off n incoming things.

Parameters:n (integer) –

sample size

>>> __(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6).sample(3).fetch()
[2, 4, 5]
slice(start, stop=False, step=False)¶

Slice incoming things.

Parameters:
  • start (integer) – starting index of slice
  • stop (integer) – stopping index of slice
  • step (integer) –

    size of step in slice

    >>> # slice from index 0 to 3
>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).slice(2).fetch()
[5, 4]
>>> # slice from index 2 to 4
>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).slice(2, 4).fetch()
[3, 2]
>>> # slice from index 2 to 4 with 2 steps
>>> __(5, 4, 3, 2, 1).slice(2, 4, 2).fetch()
3
snapshot()¶

Take baseline snapshot of current incoming things.

undo(snapshot=0)¶

Restore incoming things to a previous snapshot.

Parameters:snapshot (integer) – number of steps ago e.g. 1, 2, 3 
>>> from knife import __
>>> undone = __(1, 2, 3).prepend(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
>>> undone.peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3]
>>> # undo back one step
>>> undone.append(1).undo().peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3]
>>> # undo back one step
>>>> undone.append(1).append(2).undo().peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3, 1]
>>> # undo back 2 steps
>>> undone.append(1).append(2).undo(2).peek()
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2, 3, 1]
unicode(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

unicode (str under Python 3) decode outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) –

    error handling for decoding issues

    >>> test = __([1], True, r't', b('i'), u('g'), None, (1,))
>>> test.unicode().wrap_each().peek()
(u('[1]'), u('True'), u('t'), u('i'), u('g'), u('None'), u('(1,)'))
worker(worker)¶

Assign Python callable used to process incoming things.

Parameters:worker – a Python callable
wrap(wrapper)¶

Assign object, type, or class used to wrap outgoing things. The default wrapper is list.

Parameters:wrapper –

a Python object, type, or class

>>> __(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6).wrap(tuple).peek()
(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)
wrap_each()¶

Toggle whether each outgoing thing should be individually wrapped with wrap() or whether all outgoing things should be wrapped with wrap() all at once. Default behavior is to wrap() everything at once.
